member.name: T:Amazon.CustomerProfiles.Model.CreateDomainRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the CreateDomain operation. Creates a domain, which is a container for all customer data, such as customer profile attributes, object types, profile keys, and encryption keys. You can create multiple domains, and each domain can have multiple third-party integrations.
Each Amazon Connect instance can be associated with only one domain. Multiple Amazon Connect instances can be associated with one domain.
Use this API or UpdateDomain to enable identity resolution: set Matching to true.

member.name: P:Amazon.CustomerProfiles.Model.CreateDomainRequest.DeadLetterQueueUrl
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DeadLetterQueueUrl.
The URL of the SQS dead letter queue, which is used for reporting errors associated with ingesting data from third party applications. You must set up a policy on the DeadLetterQueue for the SendMessage operation to enable Amazon Connect Customer Profiles to send messages to the DeadLetterQueue.

member.name: P:Amazon.CustomerProfiles.Model.CreateDomainRequest.DefaultEncryptionKey
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DefaultEncryptionKey.
The default encryption key, which is an AWS managed key, is used when no specific type of encryption key is specified. It is used to encrypt all data before it is placed in permanent or semi-permanent storage.

member.name: P:Amazon.CustomerProfiles.Model.CreateDomainRequest.DefaultExpirationDays
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DefaultExpirationDays.
The default number of days until the data within the domain expires.

member.name: P:Amazon.CustomerProfiles.Model.CreateDomainRequest.DomainName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DomainName.
The unique name of the domain.

member.name: P:Amazon.CustomerProfiles.Model.CreateDomainRequest.Matching
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Matching.
The process of matching duplicate profiles. If Matching = true, Amazon Connect Customer Profiles starts a weekly batch process every Saturday at 12AM UTC to detect duplicate profiles in your domains. After that batch process completes, use the GetMatches API to return and review the results.

member.name: P:Amazon.CustomerProfiles.Model.CreateDomainRequest.Tags
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Tags.
The tags used to organize, track, or control access for this resource.

member.name: T:Amazon.CustomerProfiles.Model.GetMatchesRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the GetMatches operation. This API is in preview release for Amazon Connect and subject to change.
Before calling this API, use CreateDomain or UpdateDomain to enable identity resolution: set Matching to true.
GetMatches returns potentially matching profiles, based on the results of the latest run of a machine learning process.
Amazon Connect starts a batch process every Saturday at 12AM UTC to identify matching profiles. The results are returned up to seven days after the Saturday run.
Amazon Connect uses the following profile attributes to identify matches:
PhoneNumber
HomePhoneNumber
BusinessPhoneNumber
MobilePhoneNumber
EmailAddress
PersonalEmailAddress
BusinessEmailAddress
FullName
BusinessName
For example, two or more profiles—with spelling mistakes such as John Doe and Jhn Doe, or different casing email addresses such as JOHN_DOE@ANYCOMPANY.COM and johndoe@anycompany.com, or different phone number formats such as 555-010-0000 and +1-555-010-0000—can be detected as belonging to the same customer John Doe and merged into a unified profile.

The unique name of the domain.

member.name: P:Amazon.CustomerProfiles.Model.GetProfileObjectTypeResponse.AllowProfileCreation
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property AllowProfileCreation.
Indicates whether a profile should be created when data is received if one doesn’t exist for an object of this type. The default is FALSE. If the AllowProfileCreation flag is set to FALSE, then the service tries to fetch a standard profile and associate this object with the profile. If it is set to TRUE, and if no match is found, then the service creates a new standard profile.

member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the GetProfileObjectTypeTemplate operation. Returns the template information for a specific object type.
A template is a predefined ProfileObjectType, such as “Salesforce-Account” or “Salesforce-Contact.” When a user sends a ProfileObject, using the PutProfileObject API, with an ObjectTypeName that matches one of the TemplateIds, it uses the mappings from the template.

member.name: T:Amazon.CustomerProfiles.Model.MergeProfilesRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the MergeProfiles operation. This API is in preview release for Amazon Connect and subject to change.
Runs an AWS Lambda job that does the following:
All the profileKeys in the ProfileToBeMerged will be moved to the main profile.
All the objects in the ProfileToBeMerged will be moved to the main profile.
All the ProfileToBeMerged will be deleted at the end.
All the profileKeys in the ProfileIdsToBeMerged will be moved to the main profile.
Standard fields are merged as follows:
Fields are always "union"-ed if there are no conflicts in standard fields or attributeKeys.
When there are conflicting fields:
If no SourceProfileIds entry is specified, the main Profile value is always taken.
If a SourceProfileIds entry is specified, the specified profileId is always taken, even if it is a NULL value.
You can use MergeProfiles together with GetMatches, which returns potentially matching profiles, or use it with the results of another matching system. After profiles have been merged, they cannot be separated (unmerged).

member.name: P:Amazon.CustomerProfiles.Model.MergeProfilesRequest.DomainName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DomainName.
The unique name of the domain.

member.name: P:Amazon.CustomerProfiles.Model.MergeProfilesRequest.FieldSourceProfileIds
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property FieldSourceProfileIds.
The identifiers of the fields in the profile that has the information you want to apply to the merge. For example, say you want to merge EmailAddress from Profile1 into MainProfile. This would be the identifier of the EmailAddress field in Profile1.

member.name: P:Amazon.CustomerProfiles.Model.MergeProfilesRequest.MainProfileId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property MainProfileId.
The identifier of the profile to be taken.

member.name: P:Amazon.CustomerProfiles.Model.MergeProfilesRequest.ProfileIdsToBeMerged
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ProfileIdsToBeMerged.
The identifier of the profile to be merged into MainProfileId.

member.summary:

member.name: P:Amazon.CustomerProfiles.Model.ObjectTypeField.Source
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Source.
A field of a ProfileObject. For example: _source.FirstName, where “_source” is a ProfileObjectType of a Zendesk user and “FirstName” is a field in that ObjectType.

member.name: P:Amazon.CustomerProfiles.Model.ObjectTypeField.Target
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Target.
The location of the data in the standard ProfileObject model. For example: _profile.Address.PostalCode.

member.name: T:Amazon.CustomerProfiles.Model.ObjectTypeKey
member.summary: An object that defines the Key element of a ProfileObject. A Key is a special element that can be used to search for a customer profile.

member.name: P:Amazon.CustomerProfiles.Model.ObjectTypeKey.FieldNames
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property FieldNames.
The reference for the key name of the fields map.

member.name: P:Amazon.CustomerProfiles.Model.ObjectTypeKey.StandardIdentifiers
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property StandardIdentifiers.
The types of keys that a ProfileObject can have. Each ProfileObject can have only 1 UNIQUE key but multiple PROFILE keys. PROFILE, ASSET or CASE means that this key can be used to tie an object to a PROFILE, ASSET or CASE respectively. UNIQUE means that it can be used to uniquely identify an object. If a key a is marked as SECONDARY, it will be used to search for profiles after all other PROFILE keys have been searched. A LOOKUP_ONLY key is only used to match a profile but is not persisted to be used for searching of the profile. A NEW_ONLY key is only used if the profile does not already exist before the object is ingested, otherwise it is only used for matching objects to profiles.

When adding a specific profile object, like a Contact Trace Record (CTR), an inferred profile can get created if it is not mapped to an existing profile. The resulting profile will only have a phone number populated in the standard ProfileObject. Any additional CTRs with the same phone number will be mapped to the same inferred profile.
When a ProfileObject is created and if a ProfileObjectType already exists for the ProfileObject, it will provide data to a standard profile depending on the ProfileObjectType definition.
PutProfileObject needs an ObjectType, which can be created using PutProfileObjectType.

member.name: P:Amazon.CustomerProfiles.Model.PutProfileObjectTypeRequest.AllowProfileCreation
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property AllowProfileCreation.
Indicates whether a profile should be created when data is received if one doesn’t exist for an object of this type. The default is FALSE. If the AllowProfileCreation flag is set to FALSE, then the service tries to fetch a standard profile and associate this object with the profile. If it is set to TRUE, and if no match is found, then the service creates a new standard profile.

member.name: T:Amazon.CustomerProfiles.Model.TagResourceRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the TagResource operation. Assigns one or more tags (key-value pairs) to the specified Amazon Connect Customer Profiles resource. Tags can help you organize and categorize your resources. You can also use them to scope user permissions by granting a user permission to access or change only resources with certain tag values. In Connect Customer Profiles, domains, profile object types, and integrations can be tagged.
Tags don't have any semantic meaning to AWS and are interpreted strictly as strings of characters.
You can use the TagResource action with a resource that already has tags. If you specify a new tag key, this tag is appended to the list of tags associated with the resource. If you specify a tag key that is already associated with the resource, the new tag value that you specify replaces the previous value for that tag.
You can associate as many as 50 tags with a resource.

member.name: T:Amazon.CustomerProfiles.Model.UpdateDomainRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the UpdateDomain operation. Updates the properties of a domain, including creating or selecting a dead letter queue or an encryption key.
After a domain is created, the name can’t be changed.
Use this API or CreateDomain to enable identity resolution: set Matching to true.

member.name: P:Amazon.CustomerProfiles.Model.UpdateDomainRequest.DeadLetterQueueUrl
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DeadLetterQueueUrl.
The URL of the SQS dead letter queue, which is used for reporting errors associated with ingesting data from third party applications. If specified as an empty string, it will clear any existing value. You must set up a policy on the DeadLetterQueue for the SendMessage operation to enable Amazon Connect Customer Profiles to send messages to the DeadLetterQueue.

member.name: P:Amazon.CustomerProfiles.Model.UpdateDomainRequest.DefaultEncryptionKey
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DefaultEncryptionKey.
The default encryption key, which is an AWS managed key, is used when no specific type of encryption key is specified. It is used to encrypt all data before it is placed in permanent or semi-permanent storage. If specified as an empty string, it will clear any existing value.

member.name: P:Amazon.CustomerProfiles.Model.UpdateDomainRequest.DefaultExpirationDays
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DefaultExpirationDays.
The default number of days until the data within the domain expires.

member.name: P:Amazon.CustomerProfiles.Model.UpdateDomainRequest.DomainName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DomainName.
The unique name of the domain.

member.name: P:Amazon.CustomerProfiles.Model.UpdateDomainRequest.Matching
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Matching.
The process of matching duplicate profiles. If Matching = true, Amazon Connect Customer Profiles starts a weekly batch process every Saturday at 12AM UTC to detect duplicate profiles in your domains. After that batch process completes, use the GetMatches API to return and review the results.

member.name: T:Amazon.CustomerProfiles.AmazonCustomerProfilesClient
member.summary:
Implementation for accessing CustomerProfiles
Amazon Connect Customer Profiles
Welcome to the Amazon Connect Customer Profiles API Reference. This guide provides information about the Amazon Connect Customer Profiles API, including supported operations, data types, parameters, and schemas.
Amazon Connect Customer Profiles is a unified customer profile for your contact center that has pre-built connectors powered by AppFlow that make it easy to combine customer information from third party applications, such as Salesforce (CRM), ServiceNow (ITSM), and your enterprise resource planning (ERP), with contact history from your Amazon Connect contact center.
If you're new to Amazon Connect , you might find it helpful to also review the Amazon Connect Administrator Guide.

member.name: M:Amazon.CustomerProfiles.AmazonCustomerProfilesClient.#ctor
member.summary:
Constructs AmazonCustomerProfilesClient with the credentials loaded from the application's default configuration, and if unsuccessful from the Instance Profile service on an EC2 instance.
Example App.config with credentials set.
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8" ?> <configuration> <appSettings> <add key="AWSProfileName" value="AWS Default"/> </appSettings> </configuration>

member.name: M:Amazon.CustomerProfiles.AmazonCustomerProfilesClient.CreateDomain(Amazon.CustomerProfiles.Model.CreateDomainRequest)
member.summary:
Creates a domain, which is a container for all customer data, such as customer profile attributes, object types, profile keys, and encryption keys. You can create multiple domains, and each domain can have multiple third-party integrations.
Each Amazon Connect instance can be associated with only one domain. Multiple Amazon Connect instances can be associated with one domain.
Use this API or UpdateDomain to enable identity resolution: set Matching to true.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the CreateDomain service method.
member.returns: The response from the CreateDomain service method, as returned by CustomerProfiles.
member.exception: You do not have sufficient access to perform this action.

An internal service error occurred.

member.name: M:Amazon.CustomerProfiles.AmazonCustomerProfilesClient.GetMatches(Amazon.CustomerProfiles.Model.GetMatchesRequest)
member.summary:
This API is in preview release for Amazon Connect and subject to change.
Before calling this API, use CreateDomain or UpdateDomain to enable identity resolution: set Matching to true.
GetMatches returns potentially matching profiles, based on the results of the latest run of a machine learning process.
Amazon Connect starts a batch process every Saturday at 12AM UTC to identify matching profiles. The results are returned up to seven days after the Saturday run.
Amazon Connect uses the following profile attributes to identify matches:
PhoneNumber
HomePhoneNumber
BusinessPhoneNumber
MobilePhoneNumber
EmailAddress
PersonalEmailAddress
BusinessEmailAddress
FullName
BusinessName
For example, two or more profiles—with spelling mistakes such as John Doe and Jhn Doe, or different casing email addresses such as JOHN_DOE@ANYCOMPANY.COM and johndoe@anycompany.com, or different phone number formats such as 555-010-0000 and +1-555-010-0000—can be detected as belonging to the same customer John Doe and merged into a unified profile.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the GetMatches service method.
member.returns: The response from the GetMatches service method, as returned by CustomerProfiles.
member.exception: You do not have sufficient access to perform this action.
The input you provided is invalid.
An internal service error occurred.
The requested resource does not exist, or access was denied.
You exceeded the maximum number of requests.
member.seealso: REST API Reference for GetMatches Operation

member.name: M:Amazon.CustomerProfiles.AmazonCustomerProfilesClient.MergeProfiles(Amazon.CustomerProfiles.Model.MergeProfilesRequest)
member.summary:
This API is in preview release for Amazon Connect and subject to change.
Runs an AWS Lambda job that does the following:
All the profileKeys in the ProfileToBeMerged will be moved to the main profile.
All the objects in the ProfileToBeMerged will be moved to the main profile.
All the ProfileToBeMerged will be deleted at the end.
All the profileKeys in the ProfileIdsToBeMerged will be moved to the main profile.
Standard fields are merged as follows:
Fields are always "union"-ed if there are no conflicts in standard fields or attributeKeys.
When there are conflicting fields:
If no SourceProfileIds entry is specified, the main Profile value is always taken.
If a SourceProfileIds entry is specified, the specified profileId is always taken, even if it is a NULL value.
You can use MergeProfiles together with GetMatches, which returns potentially matching profiles, or use it with the results of another matching system. After profiles have been merged, they cannot be separated (unmerged).
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the MergeProfiles service method.
member.returns: The response from the MergeProfiles service method, as returned by CustomerProfiles.
member.exception: The input you provided is invalid.
An internal service error occurred.
The requested resource does not exist, or access was denied.
You exceeded the maximum number of requests.
member.seealso: REST API Reference for MergeProfiles Operation

member.name: M:Amazon.CustomerProfiles.AmazonCustomerProfilesClient.PutProfileObject(Amazon.CustomerProfiles.Model.PutProfileObjectRequest)
member.summary:
Adds additional objects to customer profiles of a given ObjectType.
When adding a specific profile object, like a Contact Trace Record (CTR), an inferred profile can get created if it is not mapped to an existing profile. The resulting profile will only have a phone number populated in the standard ProfileObject. Any additional CTRs with the same phone number will be mapped to the same inferred profile.
When a ProfileObject is created and if a ProfileObjectType already exists for the ProfileObject, it will provide data to a standard profile depending on the ProfileObjectType definition.
PutProfileObject needs an ObjectType, which can be created using PutProfileObjectType.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the PutProfileObject service method.
member.returns: The response from the PutProfileObject service method, as returned by CustomerProfiles.
member.exception: You do not have sufficient access to perform this action.

An internal service error occurred.

member.name: M:Amazon.CustomerProfiles.AmazonCustomerProfilesClient.TagResource(Amazon.CustomerProfiles.Model.TagResourceRequest)
member.summary:
Assigns one or more tags (key-value pairs) to the specified Amazon Connect Customer Profiles resource. Tags can help you organize and categorize your resources. You can also use them to scope user permissions by granting a user permission to access or change only resources with certain tag values. In Connect Customer Profiles, domains, profile object types, and integrations can be tagged.
Tags don't have any semantic meaning to AWS and are interpreted strictly as strings of characters.
You can use the TagResource action with a resource that already has tags. If you specify a new tag key, this tag is appended to the list of tags associated with the resource. If you specify a tag key that is already associated with the resource, the new tag value that you specify replaces the previous value for that tag.
You can associate as many as 50 tags with a resource.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the TagResource service method.
member.returns: The response from the TagResource service method, as returned by CustomerProfiles.
member.exception: The input you provided is invalid.
An internal service error occurred.
The requested resource does not exist, or access was denied.
member.seealso: REST API Reference for TagResource Operation

member.name: T:Amazon.CustomerProfiles.IAmazonCustomerProfiles
member.summary:
Interface for accessing CustomerProfiles
Amazon Connect Customer Profiles
Welcome to the Amazon Connect Customer Profiles API Reference. This guide provides information about the Amazon Connect Customer Profiles API, including supported operations, data types, parameters, and schemas.
Amazon Connect Customer Profiles is a unified customer profile for your contact center that has pre-built connectors powered by AppFlow that make it easy to combine customer information from third party applications, such as Salesforce (CRM), ServiceNow (ITSM), and your enterprise resource planning (ERP), with contact history from your Amazon Connect contact center.
If you're new to Amazon Connect , you might find it helpful to also review the Amazon Connect Administrator Guide.

member.name: M:Amazon.CustomerProfiles.IAmazonCustomerProfiles.CreateDomain(Amazon.CustomerProfiles.Model.CreateDomainRequest)
member.summary:
Creates a domain, which is a container for all customer data, such as customer profile attributes, object types, profile keys, and encryption keys. You can create multiple domains, and each domain can have multiple third-party integrations.
Each Amazon Connect instance can be associated with only one domain. Multiple Amazon Connect instances can be associated with one domain.
Use this API or UpdateDomain to enable identity resolution: set Matching to true.

member.name: M:Amazon.CustomerProfiles.IAmazonCustomerProfiles.GetMatches(Amazon.CustomerProfiles.Model.GetMatchesRequest)
member.summary:
This API is in preview release for Amazon Connect and subject to change.
Before calling this API, use CreateDomain or UpdateDomain to enable identity resolution: set Matching to true.
GetMatches returns potentially matching profiles, based on the results of the latest run of a machine learning process.
Amazon Connect starts a batch process every Saturday at 12AM UTC to identify matching profiles. The results are returned up to seven days after the Saturday run.
Amazon Connect uses the following profile attributes to identify matches:
PhoneNumber
HomePhoneNumber
BusinessPhoneNumber
MobilePhoneNumber
EmailAddress
PersonalEmailAddress
BusinessEmailAddress
FullName
BusinessName
For example, two or more profiles—with spelling mistakes such as John Doe and Jhn Doe, or different casing email addresses such as JOHN_DOE@ANYCOMPANY.COM and johndoe@anycompany.com, or different phone number formats such as 555-010-0000 and +1-555-010-0000—can be detected as belonging to the same customer John Doe and merged into a unified profile.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the GetMatches service method.
member.returns: The response from the GetMatches service method, as returned by CustomerProfiles.
member.exception: You do not have sufficient access to perform this action.
The input you provided is invalid.
An internal service error occurred.
The requested resource does not exist, or access was denied.
You exceeded the maximum number of requests.
member.seealso: REST API Reference for GetMatches Operation

member.name: M:Amazon.CustomerProfiles.IAmazonCustomerProfiles.MergeProfiles(Amazon.CustomerProfiles.Model.MergeProfilesRequest)
member.summary:
This API is in preview release for Amazon Connect and subject to change.
Runs an AWS Lambda job that does the following:
All the profileKeys in the ProfileToBeMerged will be moved to the main profile.
All the objects in the ProfileToBeMerged will be moved to the main profile.
All the ProfileToBeMerged will be deleted at the end.
All the profileKeys in the ProfileIdsToBeMerged will be moved to the main profile.
Standard fields are merged as follows:
Fields are always "union"-ed if there are no conflicts in standard fields or attributeKeys.
When there are conflicting fields:
If no SourceProfileIds entry is specified, the main Profile value is always taken.
If a SourceProfileIds entry is specified, the specified profileId is always taken, even if it is a NULL value.
You can use MergeProfiles together with GetMatches, which returns potentially matching profiles, or use it with the results of another matching system. After profiles have been merged, they cannot be separated (unmerged).
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the MergeProfiles service method.
member.returns: The response from the MergeProfiles service method, as returned by CustomerProfiles.
member.exception: The input you provided is invalid.
An internal service error occurred.
The requested resource does not exist, or access was denied.
You exceeded the maximum number of requests.
member.seealso: REST API Reference for MergeProfiles Operation

member.name: M:Amazon.CustomerProfiles.IAmazonCustomerProfiles.PutProfileObject(Amazon.CustomerProfiles.Model.PutProfileObjectRequest)
member.summary:
Adds additional objects to customer profiles of a given ObjectType.
When adding a specific profile object, like a Contact Trace Record (CTR), an inferred profile can get created if it is not mapped to an existing profile. The resulting profile will only have a phone number populated in the standard ProfileObject. Any additional CTRs with the same phone number will be mapped to the same inferred profile.
When a ProfileObject is created and if a ProfileObjectType already exists for the ProfileObject, it will provide data to a standard profile depending on the ProfileObjectType definition.
PutProfileObject needs an ObjectType, which can be created using PutProfileObjectType.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the PutProfileObject service method.
member.returns: The response from the PutProfileObject service method, as returned by CustomerProfiles.

member.name: M:Amazon.CustomerProfiles.IAmazonCustomerProfiles.TagResource(Amazon.CustomerProfiles.Model.TagResourceRequest)
member.summary:
Assigns one or more tags (key-value pairs) to the specified Amazon Connect Customer Profiles resource. Tags can help you organize and categorize your resources. You can also use them to scope user permissions by granting a user permission to access or change only resources with certain tag values. In Connect Customer Profiles, domains, profile object types, and integrations can be tagged.
Tags don't have any semantic meaning to AWS and are interpreted strictly as strings of characters.
You can use the TagResource action with a resource that already has tags. If you specify a new tag key, this tag is appended to the list of tags associated with the resource. If you specify a tag key that is already associated with the resource, the new tag value that you specify replaces the previous value for that tag.
You can associate as many as 50 tags with a resource.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the TagResource service method.
member.returns: The response from the TagResource service method, as returned by CustomerProfiles.
member.exception: The input you provided is invalid.
An internal service error occurred.
The requested resource does not exist, or access was denied.
